evidence.title: README (segment 2)
evidence.excerpt: Why? Because no single model is best for every task. We use selection because it leads to [higher quality code](https://voratiq.com/blog/selection-rather-than-prediction/).

evidence.title: README (segment 3)
evidence.excerpt: - Node 20+ - git - 1+ AI coding agent (Claude [>=2.0.55](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-code?tab=readme-ov-file#get-started), Codex [>=0.66.0](https://github.com/openai/codex?tab=readme-ov-file#quickstart), or Gemini [>=0.19.4](https://github.com/google-gemini/gemini-cli?tab=readme-ov-file#quick-install)) - macOS: `ripgrep` - Linux (Debian/Ubuntu): `bubblewrap`, `socat`, `ripgrep`

evidence.title: README (segment 4)
evidence.excerpt: See the [sandbox runtime docs](https://github.com/anthropic-experimental/sandbox-runtime/blob/1bafa66a2c3ebc52569fc0c1a868e85e778f66a0/README.md#platform-specific-dependencies) for guidance on the platform-specific dependencies.

evidence.title: README (segment 5)
evidence.excerpt: # Generate a spec voratiq spec \ --description "add dark mode toggle with localStorage persistence" \ --agent <agent-id>

evidence.title: README (segment 6)
evidence.excerpt: # Run agent ensemble against that spec voratiq run --spec .voratiq/specs/add-dark-mode-toggle.md

evidence.title: README (segment 7)
evidence.excerpt: Note: which agents participate in each stage is configured via the [orchestration config](https://github.com/voratiq/voratiq/blob/main/docs/configs/orchestration.md).

evidence.title: README (segment 8)
evidence.excerpt: For a detailed walkthrough, see the [tutorial](https://github.com/voratiq/voratiq/blob/main/docs/tutorial.md).
